region_description: Region affected by disaster-related corruption, weak oversight, and elite capture.

state.state_description: State facing weak institutional resilience, corruption during crises, and misuse of aid.

questions.question_text: After a major flood, 56% of citizens report having to pay bribes for basic services. How do you respond?

possible_answers: Create an anti-bribery hotline and dismiss responsible officials.
Ignore it and continue distribution as usual.
Tell citizens to report later when the crisis calms down.
answers.right_answer: Create an anti-bribery hotline and dismiss responsible officials.

questions.question_text: Reconstruction funds arriving after a disaster are at high risk of elite capture and rent-seeking. What do you implement?

possible_answers: Set up public procurement audits and publish all spending.
Let ministries distribute funds internally.
Leave reconstruction decisions to local elites for speed.
answers.right_answer: Set up public procurement audits and publish all spending.

questions.question_text: Reports show misappropriation of international aid during post-disaster recovery. What action do you take?

possible_answers: Deploy independent monitors to oversee aid distribution.
Allow ministries to continue without interruption.
Reduce aid to prevent further misuse.
answers.right_answer: Deploy independent monitors to oversee aid distribution.

questions.question_text: Disaster-related institutional breakdown increases petty corruption across local offices. How do you respond?

possible_answers: Introduce emergency oversight teams to enforce rules.
Accept the situation as unavoidable during crises.
Postpone oversight until after stabilization.
answers.right_answer: Introduce emergency oversight teams to enforce rules.

questions.question_text: Poor governance worsens disaster impact and reduces adaptive capacity. What reform do you propose?

possible_answers: Strengthen local governance and create transparent reporting tools.
Keep current structures and hope for international intervention.
Let private actors lead crisis management without oversight.
answers.right_answer: Strengthen local governance and create transparent reporting tools.

questions.question_text: Economic studies show corruption spikes in developing countries after disasters. What preventive step will you take?

possible_answers: Introduce pre-disaster procurement rules and digital audits.
Wait to evaluate corruption after the disaster ends.
Allow flexible procurement with no extra controls.
answers.right_answer: Introduce pre-disaster procurement rules and digital audits.

region_description: Region marked by authoritarian governance, severe corruption scandals and weak oversight.

state.state_description: Democracy pressured by corruption scandals, procurement controversies and political fragmentation.

questions.question_text: Israel’s Case 3000 revealed bribery and conflicts of interest in submarine procurement. How do you respond?

possible_answers: Launch a full public investigation and suspend all implicated officials.
Protect the deal to avoid national security embarrassment.
Handle it quietly to avoid political fallout.
answers.right_answer: Launch a full public investigation and suspend all implicated officials.

questions.question_text: Benjamin Netanyahu faced charges of bribery, fraud, and breach of trust. What institutional reform do you support?

possible_answers: Strengthen judicial independence and mandate transparent political-gift reporting.
Maintain current systems to avoid political destabilization.
Delay reforms until after elections.
answers.right_answer: Strengthen judicial independence and mandate transparent political-gift reporting.

questions.question_text: Beirut’s 2020 port explosion was linked to years of negligence and corruption. What policy change do you push for regionally?

possible_answers: Introduce strict hazardous-material oversight and anti-corruption inspections.
Allow local authorities to self-regulate cargo storage.
Focus only on rescue operations and skip governance reforms.
answers.right_answer: Introduce strict hazardous-material oversight and anti-corruption inspections.

questions.question_text: Gaza reconstruction carries high risk of diversion and fraud. What system do you implement?

possible_answers: Create joint international-local audit teams with full transparency.
Leave oversight entirely to donor flows.
Allow local authorities full control without audits.
answers.right_answer: Create joint international-local audit teams with full transparency.

questions.question_text: Surveys show 69% of Palestinians believe their judiciary is corrupt. What is your solution?

possible_answers: Install independent judicial review bodies and protect whistleblowers.
Ignore the survey and maintain existing structures.
Replace judges without structural reforms.
answers.right_answer: Install independent judicial review bodies and protect whistleblowers.

questions.question_text: Aid to Gaza and West Bank suffers from weak oversight, raising risks of diversion. What action do you take?

possible_answers: Introduce transparent procurement and digital tracking of all donor funds.
Let political actors compete for control of aid distribution.
Reduce external monitoring to avoid political tension.
answers.right_answer: Introduce transparent procurement and digital tracking of all donor funds.

region_description: Advanced region with strong institutions but ongoing political-finance scandals.

state.state_description: High CPI score yet troubled by slush funds, opaque political donations, and revolving-door corruption.

questions.question_text: The 2023–2024 LDP slush fund scandal hid over 600 million yen in unreported donations. What do you propose?

possible_answers: Conduct a forensic audit and enforce strict donation reporting laws.
Let party leaders resolve the scandal internally.
Delay reforms until public attention fades.
answers.right_answer: Conduct a forensic audit and enforce strict donation reporting laws.

questions.question_text: Japan faces recurring amakudari cases—retired officials joining firms they once regulated. What measure do you adopt?

possible_answers: Enforce multi-year cooling-off periods and mandatory disclosure.
Accept the practice as a cultural tradition.
Privately advise firms to keep appointments low-profile.
answers.right_answer: Enforce multi-year cooling-off periods and mandatory disclosure.

questions.question_text: Corporate scandals in Japan show recurring accounting fraud and cover-ups. What is your response?

possible_answers: Introduce criminal penalties for executives and regular third-party audits.
Ask companies to self-report only major incidents.
Avoid stricter rules to not harm competitiveness.
answers.right_answer: Introduce criminal penalties for executives and regular third-party audits.

questions.question_text: Political factions in Japan maintain opaque fundraising structures. How do you proceed?

possible_answers: Mandate real-time disclosure of all political donations.
Publish yearly summaries without full details.
Allow internal party reporting without public access.
answers.right_answer: Mandate real-time disclosure of all political donations.

questions.question_text: Sports committee officials accepted undeclared luxury gifts. What is your policy?

possible_answers: Refer all officials to prosecutors and publish all gift records.
Privately ask them to correct disclosures.
Ignore it to avoid embarrassment before events.
answers.right_answer: Refer all officials to prosecutors and publish all gift records.

questions.question_text: Japan’s governance suffers from semi-informal faction financing. What do you propose?

possible_answers: Ban unreported faction fundraising and create a public registry.
Allow factions to maintain their traditional fundraising networks.
Permit informal donations as long as they stay secret.
answers.right_answer: Ban unreported faction fundraising and create a public registry.

region_description: Region with strong democratic institutions but growing polarization and corruption scandals.

state.state_description: A democracy facing institutional distrust, political corruption, and record-low CPI scores.

questions.question_text: Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas accepted undeclared luxury gifts for years. What do you support?

possible_answers: Impose mandatory disclosure and independent ethics audits.
Issue a mild warning.
Defend the justice as having a ‘right to privacy’.
answers.right_answer: Impose mandatory disclosure and independent ethics audits.

questions.question_text: Senator Bob Menendez was found with gold bars linked to bribery. What is your move?

possible_answers: Support full prosecution and removal from office.
Ask him to resign quietly.
Claim the accusations are politically motivated.
answers.right_answer: Support full prosecution and removal from office.

questions.question_text: The 2021 Capitol attack showed institutional vulnerability. What reform do you prioritize?

possible_answers: Strengthen election certification safeguards and extremist monitoring.
Avoid major changes to maintain political stability.
Reduce transparency around election procedures.
answers.right_answer: Strengthen election certification safeguards and extremist monitoring.

questions.question_text: The U.S. reached a record-low CPI score (65) due to political money influence. What action do you take?

possible_answers: Introduce strict limits on corporate donations and super-PACs.
Delay reforms for future administrations.
Maintain the status quo to protect free-market politics.
answers.right_answer: Introduce strict limits on corporate donations and super-PACs.

questions.question_text: BLM protests revealed police misconduct and lack of accountability. What do you propose?

possible_answers: Create federal police oversight and transparency rules.
Suspend a few officers and close the case.
Dismiss misconduct footage as unreliable.
answers.right_answer: Create federal police oversight and transparency rules.

questions.question_text: Press freedom declined to its lowest U.S. ranking ever due to financial crises and political hostility. What do you support?

possible_answers: Fund independent journalism and protect media from political interference.
Let newspapers fail—market forces decide.
Reduce access for journalists to avoid conflicts.
answers.right_answer: Fund independent journalism and protect media from political interference.
